message.entry: Inertial navigation system and GNSS/GPS simulation model.

The block outputs noise corrupted versions of the input position, velocity, and orientation. Specify additional kinematics to simulate noise-corrupted acceleration and angular velocity. Simulate GNSS loss by specifying a position error factor.
Vary the Roll, Pitch, Yaw, Position and Velocity accuracies to change the noise levels present in the output signals. Accuracy is defined as the standard deviation of the noise.

The Position and Velocity input ports should be N-by-3 vectors. The Orientation input port should be an N-by-4 quaternion array, a 3-by-3-by-N array of rotation matrices, or an N-by-3 array of Euler angles in degrees.

entry.note: This is where the object is attached to the platform relative to the center of the platform. It's a distance from center. Equivalently : Attachment point

message.entry: This block was designed with a newer version of Simulink. Unfortunately, your Simulink version does not support these features.
